pullRequest.title: Replace the Input/Output objects for the semantic phase with Decorations in Painless
pullRequest.bodyText:
This change adds a decoration system for the phases used on the user tree. The Input and Output objects used during the semantic phase to support symbol existence, type checking, control flow checking, etc. are replaced by decorations on the "user" tree nodes instead.
Two new classes are introduced for this - Decorator and Decorations.
Decorator creates both a HashMap and HashSet for each node in the user tree as part of an array based on the user tree nodes' ids. (This avoids excessive hash lookups.) The HashMap contains decorations that require additional information such as types, while the HashSet contains conditions that are true if they exist within the HashSet and false, otherwise. (Many boolean conditions are set against the tree nodes during the semantic phase. This allows us to re-use condition objects instead of having to create a bunch of empty ones.) The decorations and conditions replace the data stored in the Input/Output objects.
Decorations contains all the small classes that replace each of the variables in the Input/Output objects in a 1 to 1 mapping.
The advantages of this decoration system are the following:

Strict decoupling of the data collected during the semantic phase from the user tree.
Allows us to split up the semantic phase into multiple phases easily. Each phase would have the expectation of using existing decorations from previous phases along with adding new decorations as more information is processed waling the tree. This means that we can add new phases easily for extensibility and split up the current semantic phase which does three separate things - gathering initial user function information, semantic validation, and creation of an IR tree.
Allows us to add new decorations/conditions easily for extensibility. This is particularly useful for adding new features outside of standard Painless moving forward.

All the user tree nodes are updated to use this system, hence the larger change here.
Other changes include renaming ScopeTable to WriteTable for the ir tree to avoid any confusion of what's used where, and removing statement counting from the loop counting where iterations is nearly the same and a lot simpler.

nodes.bodyText: Consider renaming this to "true clause" or something more evocative.

commit.message: rename left/right to true/false for user conditional node
add tests for not a statement
move isDefOptimized to output instead of as mutable state on the nodes

remove AStoreable and give individual nodes responsibility to check
write
clean up write messages and add tests
elimate extraneous new array function reference ir node
switch ir function ref nodes to different types
remove ILambda in favor of ir tree calculating def method call recipe
remove sub nodes from user tree
remove PainlessCast from output as it's completely local
removed ambiguity in parsing related to casting versus binary
handle negation in the user tree instead of relying on the walker
add guards for invalid static values
add partial types tests and not a symbol tests
add tests for valid static types
add precedence node to handle final lexer hack removal path
move prefix into nodes its actually used in
Use block instead of list of statements for Lambda
add primitive types to remove binary recognition of cast
remove remaining node instantiations within the semantic pass
partial first pass of cleaning up members of user tree nodes
setup user nodes for external pass by making members private w/ getters
name changes Scope to SemanticScope, ScriptRoot to ScriptScope
remove DType nodes and remove SDeclaration from SCatch
finish converting output.actual to decorator value
change expression output static type to be a decoration
replace user statement input with decorations
remove statement count from statement output
remove unnecessary test code from Walker
